column4: is it possible to set apt-get to install data in a users directory?
how long does mingw usually take to install from the .sh file?
this is not recommended because the package manager doesn't know about these programs, but some programs will work if you extract the package to a user directory with file-roller.
also make sure to set $PATH to the user's bin directory in .bashrc
my web server does this because I share a server with a few other websites.
evolutiion should ask for it...
it isn't
what have you done so far?
run seahorse to see if there's already an entry for your email account.
hit ctrl+F2 and type "seahorse"
It shows you your stored passwords
there isn't an entry.
have you confirmed that your account information was entered correctly in evolution's preferences?
It sounds like you haven't entered the right server information.  Check your preferences
i checked the preferences. It doesn't have a password, it never asked for one
I DID NOT SAY PASSWORD.  Check your SERVER information.  If you enter the correct server information, Evolutions prompts for a password when you check for new mail.
what mail server are you trying to connect to?
the server info is correct.
localhost port 1080
i telnetted it today and have not cut it off yet
sounds to me like it's a problem with your mail server.  Evolution is pretty straightforward.
